name: Quick JS Injection
body:
### Make sure the Chrome Bookmarklet bar is shown
![Chrome Show Bookmarlet Bar](https://www.dropbox.com/s/7aruzk2ht9ztag3/Screenshot%202015-06-23%2008.58.59.png?dl=0)

### Right click and add each link as a bookmarklet

This will prompt you for a new javascript file to inject.
[Inject New URL](javascript:(function()%7B(function()%20%7Bwindow.__JS_bookmarklet_clear_last_url%20%3D%20true%3B(function(d%2C%20t)%20%7Bwhile%20(t.length)%20%7Bvar%20s%20%3D%20d.createElement(%22script%22)%3Bs.src%20%3D%20t.shift()%3Bd.head.appendChild(s)%3B%7D%7D)(document%2C%5B%22https%3A%2F%2Fs3.amazonaws.com%2Fjs-bookmarklet-crossdomain-storage%2Flast_url_bookmarklet.js%22%5D)%7D)()%7D)())

Once that's done, try entering this: https://s3.amazonaws.com/js-bookmarklet-crossdomain-storage/test.js


This will inject the last url you injected. So if you refresh the page, or go to a different page, you don't have to re-enter the javascript file url.
[Inject Last URL](javascript:(function()%7B(function()%7B(function()%7B(function(d%2Ct)%7Bwhile(t.length)%20%7Bvar%20s%3Dd.createElement(%22script%22)%3Bs.src%3Dt.shift()%3Bd.head.appendChild(s)%3B%7D%7D)(document%2C%5B%22https%3A%2F%2Fs3.amazonaws.com%2Fjs-bookmarklet-crossdomain-storage%2Flast_url_bookmarklet.js%22%5D)%7D)()%7D)()%7D)())

Once you've right clicked on each link and saved them as a bookmarklet, try them out. The final result should look like this:
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
